title: Greece ‘agrees’ new bailout
text:
Save 
Greece has broadly agreed terms on a third bailout as it looks to move on from months of financial uncertainty. 
Finance minister Euclid Tsakalotos said that “two or three small issues” needed to be ironed out, according to news agency Reuters. 
The country needs to secure a deal before August 20 when €3 billion needs to be paid to the European Central Bank. 
Politicians in Greece are hoping to secure around £60 billion in new funds. Readers' comments (1) Anonymous | Tue, 11 Aug 2015 12:35 pm 
Watch this space - in about 4/6 months the begging bowl will be out again.
